title: Failing JMS CTS caused by incorrect imqenv.conf
body:
`instances` folder containing jms broker setup/config files should get created under `glassfish5/glassfish/domains/domain1/imq/instances/imqbroker` but is getting created under `glassfish5/mq/var/instances/imqbroker` in Eclipse Glassfish. 

Where instances folder gets created is probably determined by `IMQ_DEFAULT_VARHOME` property in 'glassfish5/mq/etc/imqenv.conf` which is empty in Eclipse Glassfish wherein in case of Oracle Glassfish, it contained some info.

Fixing this probably will fix the JMS CTS failures.

Please note that Eclipse Glassfish 5.1.0 integrates version [5.1.3](https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/openmq/releases/tag/5.1.3-RELEASE) of OpenMQ. (Both are staging releases at present).

Here is the snippet from `glassfish5/mq/etc/imqenv.conf` of Oracle Glassfish
```
#!/bin/sh
# Default location of J2SE
# IMQ_DEFAULT_JAVAHOME=/usr/java
#
# Default location of MQ's "/var" filesystem
# IMQ_DEFAULT_VARHOME=/var/imq
#
# Default external JARs to be included on the CLASSPATH,
# e.g. JDBC drivers and/or JAAS LoginModules.
# This is a ':'  separated list or ";' separate list on windows of JAR/ZIP
# files that will be included in the CLASSPATH.
#
# IMQ_DEFAULT_EXT_JARS=
IMQ_DEFAULT_VARHOME=../../glassfish/domains/domain1/imq
```

title: NA
body: [OpenMQ 5.1.3](https://oss.sonatype.org/content/groups/staging/org/glassfish/mq/mq-distribution/5.1.3/) has been re-released. It has the expected `imqenv.conf` file.

title: Default value of imqPortMapperSoTimeout
body:
We propose to change the default value of the imqPortMapperSoTimeout property added in #144 from a setting none (timeout does not occur) to some values (one minute etc.)

In the present situation, when the phenomenon of #129 occurs, it is stuck indefinitely, the influence on the user is great.

For this reason, I think that it is better for timeout to occur as the default behavior.

title: Provide jaxm-api jar through maven under EPL/GPL license
body:
Currently there is no way to cleanly integrate with [JAXM API](https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/openmq/tree/EE4J_8/mq/main/jaxm-api) provided by EF while having build of different project on maven.

What I would like to do:

-  add sth like following to my [pom](https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/metro-saaj/blob/master/pom.xml) in SAAJ RI:
```
    <dependency>
        <groupId>org.glassfish.mq</groupId>
        <artifactId>jaxm-api</artifactId>
        <version>5.1.0</version>
        <scope>provided</scope>
        <optional>true</optional>
    </dependency>
```
- add sth like following into my module-info:
`requires static jaxm.api`
- let felix-bundle-plugin generate following line (among others):
```
Import-Package: 
...
 javax.xml.messaging;resolution:=optional,
...
```
- probably remove some reflection calls from [HttpSOAPConnection](https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/metro-saaj/blob/master/src/main/java/com/sun/xml/messaging/saaj/client/p2p/HttpSOAPConnection.java#L102)


All I can do right now is either to use [org.glassfish.mq:jaxm-api:5.1](https://search.maven.org/artifact/org.glassfish.mq/jaxm-api/5.1/jar) which:
* does not have module-info nor automatic module name in manifest
* is not available built by Eclipse Foundation even though it should be and have appropriate license (5.1 is under CDDL/GPL)
or
* ignore availability of jaxm, mainly when using modules on JDK 11+

title: HttpTunnelServlet missing in imqhttp(s).war
body:
The imqhttp.war and imqhttps.war are delivered with glassfish in directory mq\lib.
When trying to deploy imqhttp(s).war multiple ClassNotFoundException: com.sun.messaging.jmq.httptunnel.tunnel.servlet.HttpTunnelServlet are thrown.

First opened here in glassfish project: (not sure where it shoud be)
https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/glassfish/issues/22774#issue-466334566

## Environment Details
* GlassFish Version: Release 5.1.0
* Open MQ Version: Release 5.1.4
* JDK version: openjdk version "1.8.0_202", Corretto-8.202.08.2
* OS: Windows 10

----------

## Problem Description
The imqhttp(s).war is missing the entire package com.sun.messaging.jmq.httptunnel
which usually contains the HttpTunnelServlet servlet.
The servlet class HttpTunnelServlet is expected to be there as specified in web.xml.

## Impact of Issue
It is not possible to tunnel mq via http(s)

body:
The help documentation for imqusermgr encode and decode is incorrect.

## Environment Details
* GlassFish Version (and build number):5.1
* JDK version:1.8
* OS:Windows 10

----------

## Problem Description
The imqusermgr help contains the following information:
```
C:\glassfish5\mq\bin>imqusermgr -h

imqusermgr encode -src <unencoded-passfile> -target <encoded-passfile>
imqusermgr decode -src <encoded-passfile> -target <unencoded-passfile>

```

"-target" is listed as a required option. However, it is not really necessary.The "-f" option can also be specified.

## Steps to reproduce
```
C:\glassfish5\mq\bin>imqusermgr encode -src C:\test.txt -f
Encoding file where:

Source File    C:\test.txt
Target File    C:\test.txt.encode

The file is successfully encoded
```

```
C:\glassfish5\mq\bin>imqusermgr decode -src C:\test.txt -f
Decoding file where:

Source File    C:\test.txt
Target File    C:\test.txt.decode

The file is successfully decoded
```

title: current imq client maven coordinates
body:
Sorry If this is a duplicate or RTFM but I could not find a current maven release for the openmq jms client. I use the following maven coordinates to pull in the openmq imq client 5.1 which dates back to 2014. _mq-distribution_ seems under active development with regular releases.

```
      <dependency>
        <groupId>org.glassfish.mq</groupId>
        <artifactId>imq</artifactId>
        <version>5.1</version>
      </dependency>
```

What are the current maven coordinates for the imq client?

body:
`SNAPSHOT`s from current master (b7e25892e97435e687d7f5db338d0c7cce4e74b0) of mq-broker, mqjmsra-ra and many others are now available at https://jakarta.oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots/org/glassfish/mq.
They are not deployed continuously as for now.
They are not deployed in release job as for now.

title: NA
body:
> SNAPSHOTs ... are available at ...

Thanks a lot, this very helpful. I need release dependencies and have already found appropriated solution: [Github Packages](https://github.com/bvfalcon?page=1&repo_name=eclipse-openmq&tab=packages) can be used as Maven repository.

But of course mq-distribution with zip-type artifact absolutely not enough. For example, I want to write test-module for Apache Camel using Open MQ [instead of Active MQ](https://github.com/apache/camel/blob/main/test-infra/camel-test-infra-activemq/pom.xml#L61-L95). How can I do this with only zip-artifact?
This is only one case, where Open MQ subsystems as maven dependencies can be used. They can be dozen for 10 minutes invented.

Currently I see the following ugly workarounds:
- Extract the imq.jar from mq-distribution.zip
- Copy the imq.jar from the corresponding glassfish distribution

and
- put store the imq.jar directy in my project
- deploy the imq.jar into local m2 repository (maven coordiantes as it was done for 5.1)

Nobody can use the mq-distribution zip artifact directly.

title: NA
body:
Thank you for explaining how the OpenMQ artifacts should be used.
The mq-client artifact looks like it could be the right dependency.
I replaced the dependency on imq with mq-client for testing purpose.

Unfortunately this can not be tested with my project, because it is based on:
- Glassfish 6.0.0 (OpenMQ 6.1)
- Jakarta 9.0
- Java SE 8

The OpenMQ 6.4.0-SNAPSHOT artifacts currently
- don't fit together in minor version (6.4 <-> 6.1)
- is incompatible in class file version (class file has wrong version 55.0, should be 52.0)

As soon as my project is sufficiently advanced in the migration with Jakarta and Java SE, this can be tested again.

title: NA
body:
I just migrated my custom openmq-spring-boot-starter using the **mq-client** dependency.

**Repository Setup**

```
<repository>
  <id>jakarta-snapshots</id>
  <name>jakarta-snapshots</name>
  <url>https://jakarta.oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots</url>
  <snapshots>
    <enabled>true</enabled>
  </snapshots>
  <releases>
    <enabled>false</enabled>
  </releases>
</repository>
```

**Dependency Management**

```
<dependency>
    <groupId>org.glassfish.mq</groupId>
    <artifactId>mq-client</artifactId>
    <version>6.4.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
</dependency>
```

Code compiles against spring-boot-3.0.0 parent / jdk17. I have yet to test a real JMS connection.

title: Store.takeoverBrokerStore(x, UID, x, z) only throws
body:
There is this overloaded method (for now let's look at the one with `UID` parameter)
https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/openmq/blob/470f3e63bfd78dfd5c24a39f844347c1dbc982fb/mq/main/mq-broker/broker-core/src/main/java/com/sun/messaging/jmq/jmsserver/persist/api/Store.java#L732-L735
However two known to me implementations
https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/openmq/blob/470f3e63bfd78dfd5c24a39f844347c1dbc982fb/mq/main/mq-broker/persist-jdbc/src/main/java/com/sun/messaging/jmq/jmsserver/persist/jdbc/JDBCStore.java#L59
https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/openmq/blob/470f3e63bfd78dfd5c24a39f844347c1dbc982fb/mq/main/mq-broker/persist-file/src/main/java/com/sun/messaging/jmq/jmsserver/persist/file/FileStore.java#L95
do not override this method so it always throws.

It wouldn't be so strange if that method had not been used. But it is:
https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/openmq/blob/470f3e63bfd78dfd5c24a39f844347c1dbc982fb/mq/main/mq-broker/cluster/src/main/java/com/sun/messaging/jmq/jmsserver/cluster/manager/ha/RepHAClusteredBrokerImpl.java#L122
and https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/openmq/blob/470f3e63bfd78dfd5c24a39f844347c1dbc982fb/mq/main/mq-broker/cluster/src/main/java/com/sun/messaging/jmq/jmsserver/cluster/manager/ha/SFSHAClusteredBrokerImpl.java#L213

I find it very interesting and wanted to share. Perhaps someone could comment to help me understand what is the meaning of that? Or maybe whole chain of calls is unused? I don't know it yet.

Declared and packaged

title: B3123 mentions Enterprise Edition
body:
For example
https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/openmq/blob/c6f87a32cb66250af00ca63e66c6fbc4902b0eec/mq/main/mq-broker/broker-comm/src/main/java/com/sun/messaging/jmq/jmsserver/resources/BrokerResources.properties#L2034

Is there **Enterprise Edition** provided by Eclipse (I guess there is not)?

I there isn't - are some features additionally licensable from Eclipse? For example https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/openmq/blob/c6f87a32cb66250af00ca63e66c6fbc4902b0eec/mq/main/mq-broker/broker-comm/src/main/java/com/sun/messaging/jmq/jmsserver/audit/api/MQAuditService.java#L39-L40 which however is inverted in https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/openmq/blob/c6f87a32cb66250af00ca63e66c6fbc4902b0eec/mq/main/mq-broker/broker-comm/src/main/java/com/sun/messaging/jmq/jmsserver/audit/api/MQAuditService.java#L152
But it isn't in the: https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/openmq/blob/c6f87a32cb66250af00ca63e66c6fbc4902b0eec/mq/main/mq-broker/broker-core/src/main/java/com/sun/messaging/jmq/jmsserver/core/Queue.java#L130-L132
If there are no such features - shouldn't all features be enabled by default?

title: mq-distribution-6.0.0-M1.zip contains duplicated entries
body:
mq-distribution-6.0.0-M1.zip (https://jakarta.oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/staging/org/glassfish/mq/mq-distribution/6.0.0-M1/) contains duplicated entries. It results in:
```
Archive:  mq-distribution-6.0.0-M1.zip
replace mq/bin/imqadmin? [y]es, [n]o, [A]ll, [N]one, [r]ename: 
```
on unzipping.

Duplicates also have the effect of executable bit being not preserved if someone decides to `unzip -o` (overwrite) instead of `unzip -n` (never overwrite) in non-interactive mode or chooses to replace files in `mq/bin` in the prompt quoted above.
It's caused by the fact the the second of each `mq/bin/*` file HAS no executable bit set (while the first has).

title: Job 1_openmq-build-and-stage uses grep to determine existence of release branch
body:
https://ci.eclipse.org/openmq/job/1_openmq-build-and-stage/64/:
```
+ echo 'Current version: 6.0.0-SNAPSHOT'
Current version: 6.0.0-SNAPSHOT
+ echo 'Release version: 6.0.0'
Release version: 6.0.0
+ echo 'Next version:    6.0.1-SNAPSHOT'
Next version:    6.0.1-SNAPSHOT
+ echo 'Release tag:     6.0.0-RELEASE'
Release tag:     6.0.0-RELEASE
+ '[' -z 6.0.0-SNAPSHOT -o -z 6.0.0 -o -z 6.0.1-SNAPSHOT ']'
+ '[' false = true ']'
+ MVN_DEPLOY_ARGS=nexus-staging:deploy
++ git remote
+ GIT_ORIGIN=origin
+ echo '-[ Prepare branch ]-------------------------------------------------------------'
-[ Prepare branch ]-------------------------------------------------------------
++ git branch -r
++ grep origin/6.0.0
+ [[ -n   origin/6.0.0-RC3 ]]
+ '[' false = true ']'
+ echo 'Error: origin/6.0.0 branch already exists'
Error: origin/6.0.0 branch already exists
+ exit 1
```
Unfortunately - `6.0.0-RC3` matches and causes failure.

title: NA
body:
Hmmm, indeed, it should be a line by line comparison of the lines returned by `git branch -r`.

There's a few more of those greps in the standard scripts that at some points must cause issues (like grepping the entire pom etc).

title: Remove HADB-related code
body: https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/openmq/blob/77b7bec3047874c459c6ff34710e9f3d27563e20/docs/mq/mq-release-notes/src/main/jbake/content/release-notes.adoc#L403

title: Cannnot execute imqcmd with typing password.
body:
imqcmd fails because Username can be entered but Password cannot be entered from the console.
```
$ mq/bin/imqbrokerd -port 27676 -name brokertest -Dimq.autocreate.queue=false -Dimq.autocreate.topic=false &
:

$ mq/bin/imqcmd create dst -n JMSQueue -b localhost:27676 -t q -o maxNumMsgs=100
Username: admin
Password: Creating a destination with the following attributes:

Destination Name          JMSQueue
Destination Type          Queue
Max Number of Messages    100

On the broker specified by:

-------------------------
Host         Primary Port
-------------------------
localhost    27676

Sep 21, 2021 3:48:50 PM com.sun.messaging.jmq.jmsclient.ExceptionHandler logCaughtException
WARNING: [I500]: Caught JVM Exception: javax.security.auth.login.LoginException: null
Error while connecting to the broker on host 'localhost' and port '27676'.
[C4038]: javax.security.auth.login.LoginException: null
Please verify that there is a broker running on the specified host and port or
use the '-b' option to specify the correct broker host and port.

Creating the destination failed.
```
This issue is reproduced with the latest MQ with the latest OpenJDK 11.

It is probably because Password.getPasswordFromJavaConsole() call java.io.Console.readPassword() with null arg, which causes an internal NPE. I think it can be called without arguments here. (Password.java#L45)

https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/openmq/blob/4d92f706b2d342d5e9e7650b4194dc78f1f4f3c9/mq/main/comm-util/src/main/java/com/sun/messaging/jmq/util/Password.java#L36-L45

This seems to be caused by a change in OpenJDK. (NPE occured at Console.java#L324)
* https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/commit/a3df1d618e9204da4162191c359bbc383d809b94
* https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/master/src/java.base/share/classes/java/io/Console.java#L324

title: NA
body: Seems it was introduced in bd558fe72d10a31ad65c123e31507f779514dc86. The pre-modified `Password` used no-arg indeed. Thanks for finding and the fix.

title: Physical destination autocreate properties affect the default value for manually created physical destinations
body:
## Environment
* GlassFish 6.2.3-SNAPSHOT (HEAD:ad6fefc)
* Openmq 6.3.0-SNAPSHOT (HEAD:7c55002)

## Problem Description
The following properties affect the default values for manually created physical destinations
- imq.autocreate.destination.maxNumProducers
- imq.autocreate.queue.maxNumActiveConsumers
- imq.autocreate.queue.maxNumBackupConsumers
- imq.autocreate.queue.consumerFlowLimit
- imq.autocreate.queue.localDeliveryPreferred
- imq.autocreate.destination.useDMQ

These are properties for autocreate and should not affect the default values for manually created physical destinations.

## Steps to reproduce
```
#### 1. start mq
$ /glassfish6/mq/bin/imqbrokerd -name remote &

#### 2. create a queue and check params
$ QUEUE_NAME=Queue001
$ /glassfish6/mq/bin/imqcmd create dst -t q -n $QUEUE_NAME -u admin -pw admin
$ /glassfish6/mq/bin/imqcmd query dst -b localhost:7676 -t q -n $QUEUE_NAME -u admin -pw admin
(----snip----)
Max Number of Messages                unlimited (-1)
Max Total Message Bytes               unlimited (-1)
Max Bytes per Message                 unlimited (-1)
Max Number of Producers               100
Max Number of Active Consumers        unlimited (-1)
Max Number of Backup Consumers        0
                                      
Limit Behavior                        REJECT_NEWEST
Consumer Flow Limit                   1000
Is Local Destination                  false
Local Delivery is Preferred           false
Use Dead Message Queue                true
XML schema validation enabled         false
XML schema URI List                   -
Reload XML schema on failure          false
(----snip----)

#### 3. create a topic and check params
$ TOPIC_NAME=Topic001
$ /glassfish6/mq/bin/imqcmd create dst -t t -n $TOPIC_NAME -u admin -pw admin
$ /glassfish6/mq/bin/imqcmd query dst -b localhost:7676 -t t -n $TOPIC_NAME -u admin -pw admin
(----snip----)
Max Number of Messages                  unlimited (-1)
Max Total Message Bytes                 unlimited (-1)
Max Bytes per Message                   unlimited (-1)
Max Number of Producers                 100
                                        
Limit Behavior                          REJECT_NEWEST
Consumer Flow Limit                     1000
Is Local Destination                    false
Use Dead Message Queue                  true
XML schema validation enabled           false
XML schema URI List                     -
Reload XML schema on failure            false
(----snip----)

#### 4. stop mq
$ /glassfish6/mq/bin/imqcmd shutdown bkr -u admin -pw admin

#### 5. start mq with non-default autocreate props
$ /glassfish6/mq/bin/imqbrokerd -name remote \
    -Dimq.autocreate.topic.consumerFlowLimit=2000 \
    -Dimq.autocreate.queue.consumerFlowLimit=200 \
    -Dimq.autocreate.queue.maxNumActiveConsumers=2 \
    -Dimq.autocreate.queue.maxNumBackupConsumers=2 \
    -Dimq.autocreate.queue.localDeliveryPreferred=true \
    -Dimq.autocreate.destination.isLocalOnly=true \
    -Dimq.autocreate.destination.maxNumMsgs=200000 \
    -Dimq.autocreate.destination.maxTotalMsgBytes=20m \
    -Dimq.autocreate.destination.maxNumProducers=200 \
    -Dimq.autocreate.destination.maxBytesPerMsg=20k \
    -Dimq.autocreate.destination.limitBehavior=REMOVE_OLDEST \
    -Dimq.autocreate.destination.useDMQ=false &
(----snip----)
[#|2021-10-13T12:15:31.261+0900|FORCE|6.3.0|imq.log.Logger|_ThreadID=1;_ThreadName=main;|Broker Properties: imq.autocreate.destination.isLocalOnly=true, imq.autocreate.destination.maxBytesPerMsg=20k, imq.autocreate.queue.localDeliveryPreferred=true, imq.autocreate.destination.maxNumMsgs=200000, imq.autocreate.destination.useDMQ=false, imq.instancename=remote, imq.autocreate.queue.maxNumActiveConsumers=2, imq.autocreate.queue.maxNumBackupConsumers=2, imq.autocreate.topic.consumerFlowLimit=2000, imq.autocreate.queue.consumerFlowLimit=200, imq.autocreate.destination.limitBehavior=REMOVE_OLDEST, imq.autocreate.destination.maxTotalMsgBytes=20m, imq.autocreate.destination.maxNumProducers=200
|#]
(----snip----)

#### 6. create a new queue and check params
$ QUEUE_NAME=Queue002
$ /glassfish6/mq/bin/imqcmd create dst -t q -n $QUEUE_NAME -u admin -pw admin
$ /glassfish6/mq/bin/imqcmd query dst -b localhost:7676 -t q -n $QUEUE_NAME -u admin -pw admin
(----snip----)
Max Number of Messages                unlimited (-1)
Max Total Message Bytes               unlimited (-1)
Max Bytes per Message                 unlimited (-1)
Max Number of Producers               200★
Max Number of Active Consumers        2★
Max Number of Backup Consumers        2★
                                      
Limit Behavior                        REJECT_NEWEST
Consumer Flow Limit                   200★
Is Local Destination                  false
Local Delivery is Preferred           true★
Use Dead Message Queue                false★
XML schema validation enabled         false
XML schema URI List                   -
Reload XML schema on failure          false
(----snip----)

#### 7. create a new topic and check params
$ TOPIC_NAME=Topic002
$ /glassfish6/mq/bin/imqcmd create dst -t t -n $TOPIC_NAME -u admin -pw admin
$ /glassfish6/mq/bin/imqcmd query dst -b localhost:7676 -t t -n $TOPIC_NAME -u admin -pw admin
(----snip----)
Max Number of Messages                  unlimited (-1)
Max Total Message Bytes                 unlimited (-1)
Max Bytes per Message                   unlimited (-1)
Max Number of Producers                 200★
                                        
Limit Behavior                          REJECT_NEWEST
Consumer Flow Limit                     2000★
Is Local Destination                    false
Use Dead Message Queue                  false★
XML schema validation enabled           false
XML schema URI List                     -
Reload XML schema on failure            false
(----snip----)
```

title: NA
body:
Example from the XSD of 2.0:
```
<xsd:restriction base="jakartaee:fully-qualified-classType">
<xsd:enumeration value="jakarta.resource.spi.security.PasswordCredential"/>
<xsd:enumeration value="org.ietf.jgss.GSSCredential"/>
<xsd:enumeration value="jakarta.resource.spi.security.GenericCredential"/>
</xsd:restriction>
```

title: ConcurrentModificationException during parallel subscribing and writing to the same connection
body:
Recently faced with the following exception during tests of concurrent messaging over openmq:

` 
 java.util.ConcurrentModificationException
	at java.base/java.util.HashMap$HashIterator.nextNode(HashMap.java:1597)
	at java.base/java.util.HashMap$KeyIterator.next(HashMap.java:1620)
	at com.sun.messaging.jmq.jmsclient.notification.EventHandler.triggerConsumerEvent(EventHandler.java:485)
	at com.sun.messaging.jmq.jmsclient.ConnectionImpl.triggerConsumerEvent(ConnectionImpl.java:3184)
	at com.sun.messaging.jmq.jmsclient.ReadChannel.processConsumerInfoPacket(ReadChannel.java:470)
	at com.sun.messaging.jmq.jmsclient.ReadChannel.processInfoPacket(ReadChannel.java:356)
	at com.sun.messaging.jmq.jmsclient.ReadChannel.dispatch(ReadChannel.java:191)
	at com.sun.messaging.jmq.jmsclient.ReadChannel.run(ReadChannel.java:1180)
	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:833)
`
Seems like the error is caused because of simultaneous iterating over consumerEventListeners's keySet via iterator and adding/removing entires of this HashMap. 

According to HashMap's javadoc:

> The iterators returned by all of this class's "collection view methods" are fail-fast: if the map is structurally modified at any time after the iterator is created, in any way except through the iterator's own remove method, the iterator will throw a ConcurrentModificationException.

Unfortunately, I cannot share the code reproducing given error due to the company's policy, but schema is plain simple: you just have to add/remove new instances of com.sun.messaging.jms.notification.EventListener to single reused com.sun.messaging.jms.Connection, while sending messages via given connection. After running this cycle for about 5-7 minutes exception occurs.

There is no need to share original code. But standalone reproducer to show the bug and that it is fixed by change proposed would be helpful.

> but schema is plain simple: you just have to add/remove new instances of com.sun.messaging.jms.notification.EventListener to single reused 

In that case - perhaps unit test will do.

title: Bump version of the project in master to 6.4.0-SNAPSHOT
Missing escaping / unescaping of colon in Stomp bridge (Stomp 1.1/Stomp 1.2)
body:
The Stomp 1.1 and 1.2 spec contains a formal (BNF) spec of allowed header octets:
```
header              = header-name ":" header-value
header-name         = 1*<any OCTET except CR or LF or ":">
header-value        = *<any OCTET except CR or LF or ":">
```

A colon character must be escaped/un-escaped using \c (see section "Value Encoding"):
> When decoding frame headers, the following transformations MUST be applied:
>     \r (octet 92 and 114) translates to carriage return (octet 13)
>     \n (octet 92 and 110) translates to line feed (octet 10)
>     **\c (octet 92 and 99) translates to : (octet 58)**
>     \\\ (octet 92 and 92) translates to \ (octet 92)

https://stomp.github.io/stomp-specification-1.2.html

In the stomp bridge, this transformation seems to be missing, which causes errors for example for ACK frames and for temporary queue destinations.

Example for ACK: the server sends a MESSAGE frame with the ack and the message-id headers with no colon escaping:
```
MESSAGE
subscription:{C3B6FE92-9B3B-47DA-92BF-E21C124215AB}
destination:/queue/TStomp12TestCase.TestClientAck.Q
message-id:ID:63-192.168.178.22(d7:b6:4e:4a:1c:25)-50808-1657872176971
ack:{C3B6FE92-9B3B-47DA-92BF-E21C124215AB}ID:63-192.168.178.22(d7:b6:4e:4a:1c:25)-50808-1657872176971
expires:0
redelivered:true
priority:4
timestamp:1657872176971
JMSXDeliveryCount:3
messagetype:text
content-length:9
```

```
[#|2022-07-15T10:02:57.080+0200|SEVERE|6.3.0||_ThreadID=33;_ThreadName=Grizzly-worker(5);|[BSS3002]: STOMP command ACK failed with [BSS4012]: Invalid value id for header {ED715DB3-B15D-4A73-924C-5FFFC3527DBF}ID\c63-192.168.178.22(d7\cb6\c4e\c4a\c1c\c25)-50808-1657872176971 on STOMP connection 3232320097869072640[null]
com.sun.messaging.bridge.api.StompProtocolException: [BSS4012]: Invalid value id for header {ED715DB3-B15D-4A73-924C-5FFFC3527DBF}ID\c63-192.168.178.22(d7\cb6\c4e\c4a\c1c\c25)-50808-1657872176971
        at com.sun.messaging.bridge.api.StompProtocolHandler.doACK(StompProtocolHandler.java:538)
        at com.sun.messaging.bridge.api.StompProtocolHandler.onACK(StompProtocolHandler.java:487)
        at com.sun.messaging.bridge.service.stomp.StompMessageDispatchFilter.handleRead(StompMessageDispatchFilter.java:99)
        at org.glassfish.grizzly.filterchain.ExecutorResolver$9.execute(ExecutorResolver.java:88)
        at org.glassfish.grizzly.filterchain.DefaultFilterChain.executeFilter(DefaultFilterChain.java:246)
        at org.glassfish.grizzly.filterchain.DefaultFilterChain.executeChainPart(DefaultFilterChain.java:178)
        at org.glassfish.grizzly.filterchain.DefaultFilterChain.execute(DefaultFilterChain.java:118)
        at org.glassfish.grizzly.filterchain.DefaultFilterChain.process(DefaultFilterChain.java:96)
        at org.glassfish.grizzly.ProcessorExecutor.execute(ProcessorExecutor.java:51)
        at org.glassfish.grizzly.nio.transport.TCPNIOTransport.fireIOEvent(TCPNIOTransport.java:510)
        at org.glassfish.grizzly.strategies.AbstractIOStrategy.fireIOEvent(AbstractIOStrategy.java:82)
        at org.glassfish.grizzly.strategies.WorkerThreadIOStrategy.run0(WorkerThreadIOStrategy.java:83)
        at org.glassfish.grizzly.strategies.WorkerThreadIOStrategy$WorkerThreadRunnable.run(WorkerThreadIOStrategy.java:101)
        at org.glassfish.grizzly.threadpool.AbstractThreadPool$Worker.doWork(AbstractThreadPool.java:535)
        at org.glassfish.grizzly.threadpool.AbstractThreadPool$Worker.run(AbstractThreadPool.java:515)
        at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:834)
```

Example for temporary queues: the broker sends a MESSAGE frame with the reply-to and the message-id headers with no colon escaping:
```
MESSAGE
subscription:{87742B50-2308-44BE-97AD-E9A4532ED244}
destination:/queue/TTemporaryQueueTestCase.TestTemporaryQueue.Q
message-id:ID:7424-192.168.178.22(d8:74:dc:b2:21:43)-50616-1657870225531
reply-to:/temp-queue/temporary_destination://queue/192.168.178.22/50616/1
expires:0
redelivered:false
priority:4
timestamp:1657870225531
messagetype:text
habaritest:request-2981015
JMSXDeliveryCount:1
content-length:15
```

Note: the issue only exists with clients which use Stomp protocol above 1.0, so the workaround is to stay on Stomp 1.0.

title: NA
body: It seems the other character transformations are not applied either. (source in class StompFrameMessage). Maybe I can write a fix (at least a draft) however the StompFrameMessage does not contain a reference to the Stomp protocol version of the current connection. Injecting it would be quite invasive.

title: NA
body:
https://eclipse-ee4j.github.io/openmq/guides/mq-tech-over/brokers.html#gjdmw refers to http://stomp.codehaus.org.
https://eclipse-ee4j.github.io/openmq/guides/mq-admin-guide/bridge-services.html#gjmnu refers to http://docs.codehaus.org/display/STOMP/Stomp+JMS, which then links to - something like -
http://web.archive.org/web/20150520203728/https://docs.codehaus.org/display/STOMP/Protocol which is 1.0. So I think this is what is supported.

Thus I'm not sure if there is _workaround_ or _fix_ needed here, as I can't see a bug (now). It should rather be treated as new feature(s) to support newer STOMPs I guess. (But that's just naming.)

Please submit any PR you like. If `StompFrameMessage` needs to be refactored - feel free to do so in first, separate step.

body:

title: NA
body:
I have submitted PR #1525 for issue #1524.
My ECA, which I signed yesterday, is not approved yet. Maybe this was caused by using my 'anonymous' info@...' email address. I have already changed this in my GitHub profile but the PR still indicates the error.

Regarding 1.2 support, in the Stomp protocol negotiation, Stomp 1.0 and 1.2 are handled as supported (in method getSupportedVersions() for the regular StompProtocolHandlerImpl). I have not further checked the WebSocket StompProtocolHandlerImpl, but it seems it supports only Stomp 1.2 as this is the only version returned by getSupportedVersions(). 

Most parts of Stomp 1.2 seem to be already implemented according to the specification. The methods which encode / decode Stomp frame header do not apply the escape / unescape. I will create a new issue soon.

title: Class StompFrameMessage does not know which protocol version is used on the connection
body:
The Stomp specification and 1.2 defines value encoding for all frames except CONNECT and CONNECTED:

- https://stomp.github.io/stomp-specification-1.2.html#Value_Encoding

The StompFrameMessage however is not able to perform the encoding as there is no way to access the connection's protocol version.

As a direct consequence, some frames which work correctly with Stomp 1,0 will no longer be correct with Stomp 1.2.

Therefore, we should consider to have the negotiated version accessible in the StompFrameMessage instances. 

Then - with a subsequent issue - the methods which parse headers in incoming messages, and build headers for outgoing messages, may use the protocol version to apply the correct transformation.

title: Stomp 1.2 value encoding is not implemented
body:
https://stomp.github.io/stomp-specification-1.2.html#Value_Encoding

```
The commands and headers are encoded in UTF-8. All frames except the CONNECT and CONNECTED frames will also escape any carriage return, line feed or colon found in the resulting UTF-8 encoded headers.

Escaping is needed to allow header keys and values to contain those frame header delimiting octets as values. The CONNECT and CONNECTED frames do not escape the carriage return, line feed or colon octets in order to remain backward compatible with STOMP 1.0.

C style string literal escapes are used to encode any carriage return, line feed or colon that are found within the UTF-8 encoded headers. When decoding frame headers, the following transformations MUST be applied:

    \r (octet 92 and 114) translates to carriage return (octet 13)
    \n (octet 92 and 110) translates to line feed (octet 10)
    \c (octet 92 and 99) translates to : (octet 58)
    \\ (octet 92 and 92) translates to \ (octet 92)

Undefined escape sequences such as \t (octet 92 and 116) MUST be treated as a fatal protocol error. Conversely when encoding frame headers, the reverse transformation MUST be applied.

The STOMP 1.0 specification included many example frames with padding in the headers and many servers and clients were implemented to trim or pad header values. This causes problems if applications want to send headers that SHOULD not get trimmed. In STOMP 1.2, clients and servers MUST never trim or pad headers with spaces.
```


OpenMQ does not apply the transformations for carriage return, line feed or colon octets and for the backslash character.

Proposal:
With this issue the implementation of the transformations will be addressed. Other parts of this specification section will be implemented with subsequent issues.

Other notes: 
* with the changes in pull request #1533 the stomp version information is accessible in the stomp frame handler
* issue #1522 may be closed (duplicate)

title: Remove top-level files from zip bundle
body:
- https://github.com/payara/Payara/issues/5882:
> I believe this top-level license file is actually the license file from OpenMQ. The way OpenMQ is included in the build is essentially by unpacking mq-dist.zip into the Payara install. Previously the license file for OpenMQ was under `mq/legal` and it has now been moved to be in the top-level of the zip (as in it's _above_ `mq`). Under the same logic, I think the `NOTICE.md` file is also coming from OpenMQ.

It's very possible for them to come from OpenMQ indeed.

I suggest to adjust this here as well.

`LICENSE.md` is there (in top-level directory) - since 5.1.3 (first release after donation to EF), and was not there before (5.1.2-b01).
It's exactly the same file:
```
$ diff -s ./LICENSE.md ./mq/legal/LICENSE.txt
Files ./LICENSE.md and ./mq/legal/LICENSE.txt are identical
```
I believe `NOTICE.md` can land in `mq/legal` too, then top-level directory would contain `mq` only and all files would be in _installation_ dir.

title: Containers and dynamic port binding
body:
Open MQ binds a client consumer or producer to a dynamics port. Because the port is different almost every time it won't work with simple port forwarding in vagrant or docker. It is possible to forward port ranges but that beats the whole purpose of isolating an app. And its not clear to me what the ranges are.

In my case the client would create a connection on localhost:7676 and then when going back it will print out an error 
```
Error occurred on connection creation [localhost:43489]. - cause: java.net.ConnectException: Connection refused (Connection refused)
```
Fails because dynamic port 43489 is not exposed on the app server container.

Tested on
- payara-server-full:5.2022.2

title: NA
body:
>     1. Fill in the necessary info for your platform in
>        $TOP/src/buildant/default.properties (I am using default file only)

It all depends on OS.

```
$ rpm -ql nspr-devel | grep prtypes.h
/usr/include/nspr4/prtypes.h

$ rpm -ql nss-devel | grep nss.h
/usr/include/nss3/nss.h
```

For compilation you have to adjust properties:
```
$ grep -E "linux.*include.*(nss|nspr)" mq/src/buildant/default.properties
mqcrt.cincludes.dbg.linux=-I${nsprhome.dbg.linux}/include/nspr -I${nsshome.dbg.linux}/include/nss
mqcrt.cincludes.opt.linux=-I${nsprhome.opt.linux}/include/nspr -I${nsshome.opt.linux}/include/nss
```

For example:

```diff
diff --git a/mq/src/buildant/default.properties b/mq/src/buildant/default.properties
index 58065e32d..d2bc20fe9 100644
--- a/mq/src/buildant/default.properties
+++ b/mq/src/buildant/default.properties
@@ -228,7 +228,7 @@ mqcrt.libname.opt.mac=libmqcrt.dylib
 nsprhome.dbg.linux=/usr
 nsshome.dbg.linux=/usr
 mqcrt.cppflags.dbg.linux=-D_DEBUG
-mqcrt.cincludes.dbg.linux=-I${nsprhome.dbg.linux}/include/nspr -I${nsshome.dbg.linux}/include/nss
+mqcrt.cincludes.dbg.linux=-I${nsprhome.dbg.linux}/include/nspr4 -I${nsshome.dbg.linux}/include/nss3
 mqcrt.cc.tool.dbg.linux=gcc
 mqcrt.ccargs.dbg.linux=-c
 mqcrt.ccopts.dbg.linux=-g -fPIC -fdiagnostics-show-option -pthread -Wno-unused-result -Wno-format
@@ -246,7 +246,7 @@ mqcrt.libname.dbg.linux=libmqcrt.so.6.3.0
 nsprhome.opt.linux=/usr
 nsshome.opt.linux=/usr
 mqcrt.cppflags.opt.linux=-DNDEBUG -DMQ_NDEBUGBREAKPOINT -DMQ_NDEBUG_OBJECT_VALIDITY
-mqcrt.cincludes.opt.linux=-I${nsprhome.opt.linux}/include/nspr -I${nsshome.opt.linux}/include/nss
+mqcrt.cincludes.opt.linux=-I${nsprhome.opt.linux}/include/nspr4 -I${nsshome.opt.linux}/include/nss3
 mqcrt.cc.tool.opt.linux=gcc
 mqcrt.ccargs.opt.linux=-c
 mqcrt.ccopts.opt.linux=-O2 -fPIC -fdiagnostics-show-option -pthread -Wno-unused-result -Wno-format
```

-----

title: Develocity integration
body:
As one of the impactful Eclipse projects, we (the Develocity Solutions team) would like to invite you to be a part of the Eclipse Develocity evaluation initiative.

This improvement will enhance the functionality of the OpenMQ build by publishing build scans to [develocity-staging.eclipse.org](https://develocity-staging.eclipse.org/), hosted by the Eclipse Foundation and run in partnership between the Eclipse Foundation and Gradle. This Develocity is freely available for use by the Eclipse OpenMQ project and all other Eclipse projects.

On this Develocity instance, the Eclipse OpenMQ project will have access not only to all of the published build scans but also to other aggregate data features such as:

* Dashboards to view all historical build scans, along with performance [trends](https://develocity-staging.eclipse.org/scans/trends?search.relativeStartTime=P28D&trends.timeResolution=week) over time
* [Build failure analytics](https://develocity-staging.eclipse.org/scans/failures?search.relativeStartTime=P28D) for enhanced investigation and diagnosis of build failures
* [Test failure analytics](https://develocity-staging.eclipse.org/scans/tests?search.relativeStartTime=P28D) to better understand trends and causes around slow, failing, and flaky tests

This will also enable you to (optionally) use build time optimization features, such as build caching and Predictive Test Selection. 

More information can be read in the [Eclipse announcement](https://www.eclipse.org/lists/cross-project-issues-dev/msg20000.html). 

**IMPORTANT:** If your project is interested in being a part of this initiative, please reach out to Eclipse infra by filling out a [helpdesk ticket](https://gitlab.eclipse.org/eclipsefdn/helpdesk/-/issues/new) to get the CI setup and credentials.

title: `PacketReference.createReference(null, null, null)` always throws `NPEx`
body:
`PacketReference.createReference(null, null, null)` always throws `NPEx`, and used here:
https://github.com/eclipse-ee4j/openmq/blob/0c798dabd100615daf35f824119436c6ce798d86/mq/main/mq-broker/broker-core/src/main/java/com/sun/messaging/jmq/jmsserver/core/Destination.java#L3004-L3010
causes messages in cluster to not be ACKed.

Affects:
- master
- 6.5.0
- 6.4.0
- 6.3.0
- 6.2.1, 6.2.0
- 6.1.1, 6.1.0
- 6.0.0
